instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message: All screen for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> are interchangeable? 2010 and 2011 models?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message:
Yes if you replace the LCD only

No if you replace complete display assembly (WiFi antenna cables different length)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message: I mean if I replace complete assembly. 2010 and 2011 different?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message:
Sorry. I think the 13-inch will fit. 

But the 11-inch 2010-display will not fit in 2011-board because of too short antenna cables.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message: I sorta works, but compare the LCD connector pin outs on the schematic and tell me what may go wrong.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2010 what board is? 2011 is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
So I can compare

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>       .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen
threads.message: Yes, scl and sda are different. Pin1
